strategy: Introduce a neural network with an embedding layer for categorical variables (e.g., passenger class, cabin deck, gender) and use continuous features (age, fare) as inputs to a dense layer. Train the model with a focus on capturing non-linear interactions between socio-economic and demographic factors, leveraging the neural network’s ability to model complex, high-dimensional patterns without relying on pre-defined strata or bins. This approach replaces engineered categorical bins with learned representations that can adaptively capture survival associations across the full distribution of data.
